p: Initial screening of EOs and PEs using disc and well diffusion test identified LO as the most active EO at the different concentrations (0.02–1 µL/mL) tested against B. cinerea ( Figure 2a) and Penicillium sp. ( Figure 2b), LO proved to be the most active EOs with a minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of 15 µL/mL and 30 µL/mL for B. cinerea and Penicillium spp., respectively.
